attributes.action: Invest in designated intercity cycle paths
attributes.additional_details: We believe that investing in intercity cycling paths would have multifaceted benefits. It would encourage people to commute by bike as opposed to cars which would be more climate-friendly, It would generate a boost in GDP as an increase in government investment, and it would promote exercise among the general population which would decrease pressure on the NHS as people live healthier lives.
attributes.background: We believe that the government should invest in intercity cycle paths to promote cycling as a form of transport while keeping busy roads separate for car use.

rejection.details:
The Government has recently announced new funding for cycle paths, you can find out more information here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/almost-300-million-to-gear-up-new-walking-wheeling-and-cycling-schemes

If you would would like this funding to be increased, you could start a new petition about this.
